turns.text: It's okay.

turns.text: Glad it's okay.

turns.text: I'll tell you what. When I get my engineering degree and I'm swimming in my swimming pool, it will be very fucking okay.

turns.speaker: BUFF
turns.text: Um, if you're talking to me, could you make some sense? 'Cause I don't speak Swahili.

turns.speaker: NAZEER
turns.text: In two more years I'll have an engineering degree. We'll sell the store, we'll move away from Burnfield and the store and you standing here.

turns.text: Good. See you later.

turns.text: You're a drunk and an idiot.

turns.text: Yeah it's okay. You know, we have a saying back home: "Either the salt is rotten or the meat."

turns.text: Come on, man. Sh, sh, sh.

turns.speaker: BUFF
turns.text: Thanks. See man?

turns.text: You know? I remember coming here with my parents.

turns.text: You make videos?

turns.text: Oh, yeah, all the time. That's what I do now.

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: You know what would be cool is, like, to do a music video, you know? But, like, you know, have it set in here. You know, like, like, like, with her and shit. You know, like, you know, like, "Closed, closed, closed, closed, closed, closed."

turns.speaker: BUFF
turns.text: "Closed, closed, closed." But with your music.

turns.speaker: PONY
turns.text: You could do it.

turns.text: I could.

turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: BUFF
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.text: Yes!

turns.text: Yeah!

turns.text: A reel?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: So you came by to see how the other half lives, huh? Well, here we are, What do you think? Pretty fucking pathetic huh? Kind of like one of those documentaries on educational TV?

turns.text: Yeah, totally.  So, uh, what do they interview you about?

turns.text: Hi.

turns.text: Hi.

turns.text: So you, like, come from a town like this or...?

turns.text: No, not really. I come from an "area". Bel Air.

turns.text: You rich?

turns.text: No, not really. Middle-class.

turns.text: Oh, me too. Middle-class.

turns.text: Maybe upper-middle-class.

turns.text: Thinks he is. Well, he is.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: He is?

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: He is.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: He is.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: And you love him a lot. He bought you a BMW for your birthday, but you finally had to move out and get your own place. I mean, I know, it's time to leave the nest. Parents hate your smoking. You didn't tell them about the abortion. All your friends got boob jobs, you got the tattoo instead. Subscribe to Vaniety Fair.

turns.text: You got everything right but the car. My dad didn't get me a BMW.

turns.text: What'd he get you?

turns.text: A Porsche.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Mm.

turns.text: Yeah. So, what about you?

turns.text: What about me? I don't have a car.

turns.text: You just seem to know all these things about me and I don't know anything about you, you know. What kind of music do you like?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Military marching bands.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: You think I'm rich and you hate me.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Now, how the hell would you know what I think? Hm? You don't know me.

turns.text: I'd like to.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Oh, yeah?

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Mm-mm.

turns.text: You know, it was the biggest mistake of my life.

turns.text: Really?

turns.text: Well, I mean, you have to understand I was just this dopey kid mopping floors and kissing officer ass. I mean, well, I enlisted right out of high school. So I just wanted something different in my life.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: "It's not a job, it's an adventure." Right? I hated it. I had to get out. So I was working in the kitchen, chopping lettuce, you know, real heroic stuff, and I, uh, I had this big fucking knife and I chopped off the tip of my little finger and three days later I was a free man.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: You cut off your little finger?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Well, they, uh they were nice enough to sew it back on.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Let's see.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: I mean, what is there to be happy about really? I mean, going to the gym, climbing the StairMaster, eating the yogurt, checking the voice mail. Smoking the low-tar cigarettes, shaving the bikini line. Sometimes I just want something different, you know?

turns.text: What was your name again?

turns.text: Erica.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Erica. So do you think you and I are alike, Erica?

turns.text: Deep down. Way down.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: It's a mistake to think that.

turns.text: It's nice to do a lot of things.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: That's what I mean.

turns.text: I'm not a nice guy.

turns.text: I know. It's okay.

turns.text: Yeah?

turns.text: Mm-hm. I'm a big girl. I can take care of myself. If I didn't want to be here, I'd be in a limo right now with a bunch of kids looking for Chinese food.

turns.text: No, no, see, you, you don't understand.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Hay? Yeah? So teach me a lesson.

turns.text: It's okay. This kind of thing happens. It's just never happened to me. I'm sorry. It's true though. Mm. So, um, what's your TCB tattoo stand for? What's that about?

turns.text: Taking care of business.

turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.text: Great.  Hi. I'm Erica.

turns.text: Jeff, Erica. God, it's so amazing to be back home.

turns.text: Oh, wow.

turns.text: I mean, we've been playing big places everywhere, but when we did that sound check at The Orpheum, it suddenly hit me. I'm playing The Orpheum, you know? I mean, the last time I played here was, uh, the prom.

turns.text: Hi.
